title.narrative: IR 3.4 REPONSE AUX URGENCES PROTECTION

description.narrative: IR3.4 : In risk areas, local stakeholders' coordination capacities to prevent shocks associated with humanitarian emergencies are strengthened & at least 50% of children affected by humanitarian emergencies benefit from protection measures & reintegration., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTIONPCR 3: By the end of 2018, the prevention and protection against all forms of violence, abuse and exploitation, as well as access to state civil service and legal protection, are significantly and equitably reinforced.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR3.4 : In risk areas, local stakeholders? coordination capacities to prevent shocks associated with humanitarian emergencies arestrengthened & at least 50% of children affected by humanitarian emergencies benefit from protection measures & reintegration.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF provided mental health and psychosocial support (MHPSS) and safe spaces to 199,231 children, including comprehensive and individual care/assistance to 3,073 children released from armed groups. A total of 4,716 unaccompanied and separated children (UASC) benefited from temporary care, protection and family tracing services and 2,179 women and children survivors of sexual and gender-based violence (SGBV) received comprehensive assistance. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020
